intro: Tylophora yemensis, commonly known as Yemen tylophora, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes various species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its flowers are usually small and clustered. Tylophora yemensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
